title: Asalanka knock seals four-wicket Sri Lanka win over New Zealand
byline: A captain’s knock by Charith Asalanka steered Sri Lanka to a hard-fought four-wicket victory over New Zealand with six balls to spare in Saturday’s Twenty20 opener in Dambulla.

title: SriLankan cancels flights due to technical issues
byline: SriLankan Airlines said that several flights have been cancelled in the past few days due to technical issues affecting multiple aircraft in their fleet.

title: Sri Lanka’s application to join BRICS to be considered: Russian Embassy
byline: Sri Lanka’s application to join BRICS will be considered in due course in consultations and consensus with numerous other bids from other countries under the chairmanship of Russia, the Russian Embassy said.

title: Couple shot dead in Ambalangoda
byline: A married couple was shot dead by an unidentified gunman on another motorcycle while they were travelling on a motorcycle in the Urawatta area of Ambalangoda today.

title: Madurai-Punalur train service extension requested to connect ferry to Sri Lanka
byline: The railway passengers associations have requested to extend the Madurai-Punalur night express train service to Nagapattinam or Karaikal to provide better access to the ferry service from Nagapattinam to Sri Lanka.

title: Qatar suspends role as mediator between Israel and Hamas
byline: Qatar has suspended its work as a mediator in ceasefire and hostage release talks between Israel and Hamas, officials say.

title: SL’s application for BRICS membership not rejected: Foreign Ministry refutes reports
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs refuted media reports that Sri Lanka’s application for BRICS membership has been rejected and that pending requests for BRICS membership from many countries including Sri Lanka will be considered by BRICS member countries in due course.

title: IMF delegation to visit Sri Lanka for third review
byline: A delegation from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) is scheduled to visit Sri Lanka next week to conduct the third review under the country’s Extended Fund Facility (EFF) programme.

title: President assures release of political prisoners, northern lands captured by security forces
byline: Steps will be taken to return the northern and eastern people’s lands taken over by the security forces for various security reasons while steps will also be taken to release political prisoners, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: Defence Secretary reviews security situation in Arugam Bay
byline: Defence Secretary, Air Vice Marshal (Retired) Spath Thuyakontha visited the Eastern Province today (Nov 10) to assess the security situation in the Arugam Bay area.
